input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: PRUCHNIK COMMUNE. Summary: Removal and Management of Municipal Sewage Sludge from the Sewage Treatment Plant in Pruchnik. Description: The subject of the order is the removal and management of municipal sewage sludge from the sewage treatment plant in Pruchnik in 2026. The service of removal of stabilized municipal sewage sludge with code 190805 from the sewage treatment plant located in Pruchnik to the place of its management and processing (from excluding recovery using the R10 method) should be carried out in a continuous handling system according to the export notification agreed with the Ordering Party, with the frequency adjusted to the amount of their accumulation in containers. The estimated amount of waste with code 190805 per year is approximately 716 Mg (average from the last three years) with hydration approx. 13% DM Details are included in, among others: Chapter III SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-11-07. Closing Date: 2025-11-19. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: BURZENIN COMMUNE. Summary: Collection and Management of Municipal Waste from the Burzenin Commune. Description: The subject of the order is a service consisting in the collection and management of municipal waste from the Burzenin commune and equipping all property owners with waste containers or bags. The scope of the order applies to residential properties and properties with cottages holiday homes or other properties used for recreational purposes. The municipal waste collection system does not cover waste generated as a result of running a business. The service will be provided in the period from signing the contract to December 31, 2027, with acceptance and waste management would be carried out from January 1, 2026 to December 31, 2027. Winter maintenance of municipal roads in the Chmielnik Commune in the 2025/2026 winter season will include: preventive actions, removal of slipperiness and snow removal, using own materials and equipment and transport. Removal should be carried out by shoveling snow to the edge of the road or parking lot in such a way that the shoveled snow does not impede pedestrian or vehicle traffic. In the event of black ice, the Contractor, in addition to the above-mentioned activities, will additionally roughen the surface by sprinkling the surface drg sand with salt. In the event of continuous, uninterrupted snowfall, snow removal should be carried out in such a way as to provide sufficient passageways and passages to ensure traffic safety in the areas designated for snow removal.5. Summary: Solid Waste Removal Services to Landfills from the So-Called Wild Dumps, From the Areas of the City of Koszalin Commune Managed by Zbm in Koszalin. Description: Subject of the proceedings: Solid waste disposal services from the so-called wild landfills from the areas of the City of Koszalin Commune managed by ZBM in Koszalin. Scope of services: Remove solid waste from the areas of the City of Koszalin Commune administered by ZBM to the landfill, including from under garbage covers or waste storage places, min. such as: construction and post-renovation waste, hazardous waste, car parts, used electrical and electronic equipment, electronics and household appliances, gas, tree branches and trees (only in situations of gas collapse due to strong wind, lightning strike, devastation on the part of humans) or municipal waste creating the so-called wild landfills, where wild landfills mean places not intended for waste storage. After completing the works, the Contractor will visually tidy up the area where the waste was stored (raking, sweeping). Detailed the scope of services, their estimated value and completion date are each time determined by the order (Appendix No. 1 to the Agreement) granted to the Contractor by the Ordering Party. The Ordering Party will pay the Contractor for the waste actually collected from ITPOK and managed by the Contractor in a given settlement period. Ordering by the Ordering Party, during the order period, less than 23,000 Mg of waste (but more than 15,000 Mg) does not entitle the Contractor to to any financial claims against the Ordering Party.<br> 2. Estimated daily amount of slag to be collected: 95 Mg/day.<br> Performer will successively collect orders, including transporting and managing waste with code 19 01 12 generated at ITPOK. The contractor is obliged to handle waste in accordance with the waste management hierarchy.<br> 5. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: COMMUNE AND CITY OF NOWE SKALMIERZYCE. Summary: Management of Ash and Textile and Clothing Waste Collected from Property Owners Living in the Commune and City of nowe Skalmierzyce.. Description: The subject of the order is a service consisting in the management of ash from households (waste code ex 20 01 99), clothing and textile waste (waste code 20 01 10), from real estate residing in the Commune and City of Nowe Skalmierzyce subject to waste management fees municipal, delivered by an entity authorized to collect from residents, in a manner consistent with the regulations. During the order execution period, according to estimates, approximately 600 tons of ash, 50 tons of clothing and textiles were transferred for disposal. The properties from which the waste will be collected are located within the administrative boundaries of the Commune and City of Nowe Skalmierzyce. The service will take place over a period of 13 months. The place of acceptance of waste for disposal must be located in an area within 25 km from the registered office of the Ordering Party. A detailed Description of the Subject of the Order is attached to SWZ.. Published Date: 2025-11-05. Closing Date: 2025-11-13. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

The scope of the order includes in particular the Contractor's provision of: PSZOK service, maintaining cleanliness and order, organizing selective collection of waste delivered by commune residents, keeping records of received waste, submitting a report to the Ordering Party, successive removal of waste from PSZOK, so as to ensure the possibility of continuous delivery of waste by residents and prevent overflow of containers, transferring waste for management in accordance with the hierarchy of transferring waste collected from property owners intended for storage to Regional Installations for processing municipal waste indicated in the Provincial Waste Management Plan Municipal.<br> The detailed scope of the service, the method of carrying out the order and the obligations of the Contractor are set out in Annex No. 4 to the SWZ, i.e. Description of the Subject of the Order.<br> The Contractor undertakes to perform the service in accordance with applicable regulations and standards, current level of technical knowledge, as well as with due care.<br> 95 section 1-2 of the Public Procurement Law requires the employment of at least one person by the contractor or subcontractor under an employment contract within the meaning of the Act of June 26, 1974 - Labor Code. .... Published Date: 2025-10-31. Closing Date: 2025-11-17. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

Comprehensive service of organizing study trips enabling participants to learn good practices in water management, exchange experiences and increase the effectiveness of local activities based on real examples of the functioning of water systems.3. The subject of the order is divided into 16 parts ("Packages"). Summary: Removal of Tree Patches Along with the Collection and Removal of the Accumulated Biomass in Order to Restore Habitat 6130 - Procedure Ii. Description: I. 1.1.1. The subject of the order is the felling of trees and the removal of deposited biomass on an area of ​​approximately 1.1 ha. The location of the work site is presented on the map constituting Appendix No. 1 to the OPZ. The trees to be removed are dense and have never been subject to maintenance work. Ordering party is not able to determine the amount of dead biomass deposited that should be removed after felling. The biomass resulting from the work should be collected and transported outside the area covered by the boundaries of Natura 2000 areas, and then disposed of. Transport of biomass other than wood is preferred large sheets dragged along the ground. The obligation to dispose of biomass lies with the Contractor.<br> 2. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: KROCZYCE COMMUNE. Summary: Winter Maintenance of Local Roads in the Kroczyce Municipality in 2026-2027. Description: The subject of the order is to provide winter maintenance services for municipal roads in the Kroczyce Commune in the years 2026-2027, including snow removal, preventing the formation of slippery surfaces, combating and eliminating slippery slopes, in order to ensure passability and limit disruptions to the flow of road traffic. execution of the order, the Contractor is obliged to: - maintain constant readiness of staff and equipment for work on the roads and observe weather conditions (passive winter road maintenance activities); performing activities related to maintaining passability by removing and combating snow slipperiness in accordance with the adopted standards and the list of roads (active conduct of winter road maintenance campaigns). The order covers the estimated workload of individual equipment: 1) plow - sand spreader - 3,000 km2) medium plow - 5 hours of work 3) light plow - 600 hours of work 4) backhoe loader - 5 hours work5) wedge plow - 10 hours of work6) sand - 160 Mg7) hardening materials - 40 MgThe length of roads subject to winter maintenance is approximately 46 km.. Published Date: 2025-10-30. Closing Date: 2025-11-07. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

output.Summary: Winter Maintenance of Local Roads in the Kroczyce Municipality in 2026-2027
output.Description: The subject of the order is to provide winter maintenance services for municipal roads in the Kroczyce Commune in the years 2026-2027, including snow removal, preventing the formation of slippery surfaces, combating and eliminating slippery slopes, in order to ensure passability and limit disruptions to the flow of road traffic. execution of the order, the Contractor is obliged to: - maintain constant readiness of staff and equipment for work on the roads and observe weather conditions (passive winter road maintenance activities); performing activities related to maintaining passability by removing and combating snow slipperiness in accordance with the adopted standards and the list of roads (active conduct of winter road maintenance campaigns). The order covers the estimated workload of individual equipment: 1) plow - sand spreader - 3,000 km2) medium plow - 5 hours of work 3) light plow - 600 hours of work 4) backhoe loader - 5 hours work5) wedge plow - 10 hours of work6) sand - 160 Mg7) hardening materials - 40 MgThe length of roads subject to winter maintenance is approximately 46 km.

Description: 1) Order called "Collection and management of municipal waste from residential properties in the Ożarowice Commune in 2026-2028" includes:<br> a) Collection and management of unsegregated (mixed) and segregated municipal waste originating from residential properties located in the Ożarowice Commune, excluding waste related to running a business.<br> b) Collection and management of municipal waste segregated from a selective municipal waste collection point.<br> 120 l, 240 l to collect waste unsegregated (mixed) and in containers with a capacity of 120 l, 240 l and/or bags for selective waste collection.<br> d) Equipping the selective municipal waste collection point with containers with a capacity of 120 l, 1100 l and containers with a capacity of 3 m3, 7 m3 for collecting municipal waste.<br> e) Organize at least once a year, collection of large-size waste in designated places for a given village in the form of a "action" or a tour of the entire commune with waste collection from outside the property.<br> f) Organizing a collection of textiles and clothing at least once a year, in the form of a tour of the entire commune with waste collection in front of the property.<br> The minimum guaranteed amount of waste corresponds to 70% of the maximum gross remuneration.<br> 3) Subject of the order, incl warunk.... Tender Value: 7000000. Currency: PLN. Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-28. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: LESZNOWOLA COMMUNE. Summary: Collection and Management of Municipal Waste from Residential Properties and Properties with Summer Houses or other Properties Used for Recreational Purposes.... Description: Collection and management of municipal waste from residential properties and properties with summer houses or other properties used for recreational purposes...<br> Management (recovery, recycling and disposal) of municipal waste collected from residential properties and properties with summer houses or other properties used for recreational purposes located in the Lesznowola Commune must be carried out in a way that ensures the achievement of appropriate levels of recycling, preparation for reuse and recovery by other methods and limiting the mass of biodegradable municipal waste sent to landfill, in accordance with the provisions of the Act of September 13, 1996 on maintaining cleanliness and order in municipalities, and the Act of December 14, 2012 on waste, Regulation of the Minister of the Environment of December 14, 2016 on the levels of recycling, preparation for reuse and recovery by other methods of certain municipal waste fractions, the Provincial Waste Management Plan and the Regulations on maintaining cleanliness and order in the commune Lesznowola.<br> As part of the order, the Contractor is obliged to collect and manage any amount of municipal waste generated on real estate where residents live and real estate where there are summer houses or other real estate used for recreational purposes located in the Lesznowola Commune.<br> Description of the subject of the order - constitutes Annex No. 13 to the SWZ.<br> Collection and management of municipal waste from real estate involvement.... Published Date: 2025-10-29. Closing Date: 2025-11-05. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed

input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: STATE TREASURY PGL LP LEŚNY DWOR FOREST DISTRICT. Summary: Providing Forest Management Services in the Leśny Dwor Forest District in 2026. input: Country: Poland. Purchaser Name: RADIOACTIVE WASTE DISPOSAL PLANT - STATE ENTERPRISE. Summary: Provision of Nuclear Safety and Radiological Protection Services in 2026. Description: The subject of the order is the provision of nuclear safety and radiological protection services in 2026 for the Radioactive Waste Disposal Facility (ZUOP), including the ZUOP facilities in Otwock and the National Radioactive Waste Repository (KSOP) in Rosary. The scope of the order includes activities related to environmental radiation monitoring on the premises and surroundings of the facilities, measurements and assessment of personnel exposure, calibration of dosimetric equipment, tests of environmental elements, as well as assessment of the state of radiological protection.<br> Part No. 1 - Monitoring environmental radiation at the ZUOP in Otwock<br> Part No. 2 - Radiation monitoring of the environment in the vicinity of the ZUOP in Otwock<br> Part No. 3 - Measurements and assessment of external and internal exposure of ZUOP personnel<br> Part No. 4 - Calibration of dosimetric equipment<br> Part No. 5 - Environmental radiation monitoring KSOP area<br> Part No. 6 - Radiation monitoring of the environment in the vicinity of the KSOP<br> Part No. 7 - Research on selected environmental elements in and around the KSOP<br> Part No. 8 - Assessment of the state of radiological protection in and around the facilities in Otwock<br> Doc Title: Provision of services in the field of nuclear safety and radiological protection in 2026<br> Contract Type: services. Published Date: 2025-10-28. Closing Date: 2025-11-25. Competition: ICB. Financier Name: Self Financed
